physdesc.extent: 1 record carton; 6 oversize rolled item storage boxes; 3 oversize boxes; 1 square flat box; 1 portfolio; 1 envelope; and 14 paintings.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the School of the Museum of Fine Arts, 2019, accession MS-2020-005.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Prior to her death, Sarah Moore Field managed and preserved a collection of papers and belongings related to the Field family, including material from her time as a student at the School of the Museum of Fine Arts. After her death, the executors of her will, in collaboration with the Trinitarian Congregational Church, donated select objects from the collection to regional museums and historical societies. A portion of the collection was sold to benefit the Trinitarian Congregational Church in North Andover, Massachusetts.

Material related to Sarah Moore Field's studies at the Museum School were donated by the executors of the Sarah Moore Field estate to the Archives of the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston and the School of the Museum of Fine Arts in 1998. The original accession numbers from the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Libraries and Archives were 2016-17, March 10, 2016; 2016-22, March 14, 2016; and 2019-16, August 14, 2019. The School of the Museum of Fine Arts became a part of Tufts University's School of Arts and Sciences in 2016, and in 2019, the collection was transferred to Digital Collections and Archives at Tufts University.
